intro: Centaurea fastigiata, commonly known as the upright centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and bright blue or purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas. Centaurea fastigiata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
